page.title: Supreme Council of the Armed Forces

rev.diff:
Line 32: Line 32:
===Transition Period & Political Reforms===
===Transition Period & Political Reforms===
  +
{{main|Timeline of the 2011 Egyptian revolution under Supreme Council of the Armed Forces}}
{{Expand section|date=April 2011}}
{{Expand section|date=April 2011}}
In its statement the Council indicated that it intends to suspend emergency laws that had been in effect for three decades, and move towards free and fair presidential elections, and provide for a safe transition to a free democratic order.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/02/11/world/middleeast/11egypt-military-statement.html| author=The New York Times |title=Statement From the Supreme Council of the Egyptian Armed Forces. |date=February 11, 2011, |accessdate=February 11, 2011}}</ref> [[:Egyptian_Revolution_of_2011#13_February|One of their first actions]] were to dissolve the [[Parliament of Egypt]], [[List of political leaders who suspended the constitution|suspend]] the [[Constitution of Egypt]], and force free, open [[Egyptian presidential election, 2011|presidential]] and [[Egyptian parliamentary election, 2011|parliamentary]] elections before the year's end and within six months.
In its statement the Council indicated that it intends to suspend emergency laws that had been in effect for three decades, and move towards free and fair presidential elections, and provide for a safe transition to a free democratic order.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/02/11/world/middleeast/11egypt-military-statement.html| author=The New York Times |title=Statement From the Supreme Council of the Egyptian Armed Forces. |date=February 11, 2011, |accessdate=February 11, 2011}}</ref> [[:Egyptian_Revolution_of_2011#13_February|One of their first actions]] were to dissolve the [[Parliament of Egypt]], [[List of political leaders who suspended the constitution|suspend]] the [[Constitution of Egypt]], and force free, open [[Egyptian presidential election, 2011|presidential]] and [[Egyptian parliamentary election, 2011|parliamentary]] elections before the year's end and within six months.
